channel.title: Comments on: Getting Grade Data from PowerSchool Pro (#TeachersCoding)
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: PowerSchool Evangelist
item.dc:creator: PowerSchool Evangelist
item.description: Yes! We are listening. Importing scores is coming soon...
item.content:encoded: Yes! We are listening. Importing scores is coming soon…

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016/11/09/getting-grade-data-from-powerschool-pro-teacherscoding/#comment-489">Erickukin</a>.
I completely agree - I figured (hoped?) that the PowerSchool folks would be adding this feature at some point since it seems so obvious.
I also would love to have grades live in a spreadsheet and periodically upload them to update, perhaps once a week. That would help reduce some of the anxiety students develop over grades being updated instantly. Maybe the PS powers that be are listening?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Erickukin.

I completely agree – I figured (hoped?) that the PowerSchool folks would be adding this feature at some point since it seems so obvious.

I also would love to have grades live in a spreadsheet and periodically upload them to update, perhaps once a week. That would help reduce some of the anxiety students develop over grades being updated instantly. Maybe the PS powers that be are listening?

item.title: By: Erickukin
item.dc:creator: Erickukin
item.description:
This is useful, although it seems that with the new 10.1 update the feature to download the scoresheet as a .csv has returned. What would be REALLY helpful is a way to go the other way. My systems would connect much better if I could use a .csv to upload grades into PTP as we could with PTG.
hmmm.... (as well as grrr....)
item.content:encoded:
This is useful, although it seems that with the new 10.1 update the feature to download the scoresheet as a .csv has returned. What would be REALLY helpful is a way to go the other way. My systems would connect much better if I could use a .csv to upload grades into PTP as we could with PTG.

hmmm…. (as well as grrr….)
